Author: Adli#5025
Content: Hi guys,  are there more informations than the official doc on the token CC features : https://docs.komodoplatform.com/cc/contracts/tokens/rpc-index.html or is there an existing project that us this CC. As I understand, it work like colored coin on Bitcoin (openassets and co), but I'm not sure ! üòÉ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes you can issue tokens

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
tokenaddress [pubkey]
tokenask numtokens tokenid price
tokenbalance tokenid [pubkey]
tokenbid numtokens tokenid price
tokencancelask tokenid asktxid
tokencancelbid tokenid bidtxid
tokenconvert evalcode tokenid pubkey amount
tokencreate name supply description
tokenfillask tokenid asktxid fillunits
tokenfillbid tokenid bidtxid fillamount
tokeninfo tokenid
tokenlist
tokenorders [tokenid]
tokentransfer tokenid destpubkey amount

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: those are the rpc calls, it has DEX functionality also

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are some test scripts, but those and the C code are all the docs that exist

Content: it is to allow passing in a vector of pubkeys (one for each vin) and having it automatically check for 1of2 addresses

Content: Cool, and in which CC is the use case?

Content: marmara

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it needs to be able to spend from potentially hundreds of different 1of2 CC addrs using the global address, but it needs to have an address to compare to

Author: Alright#0419
Alright#0419
Content: @Mihailo @dimxy this is just checking that the non-fungible data is less than 10000

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the non-fungible data is not the only thing stored in OP_RETURN, so in reality this limit is a little bit less than 10000, yes?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: ouch....  what about using constants ?

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
constants are great.
As to non-fungible data size, we could not define its exact limit, because it is floating as there may be different data kinds in the opret.  Together they all will be limited by the total opret size 10000. 
So here we just checking in advance that non-fungible data size is not too big

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
ok.  wouldn't a komodo_defs.h `OPRETURN_MAXSIZE=10000` still be better, to save an inadvertant vim/rushed/late-night typo of 10000 vs 1000 vs 100000, and across any future CCs (plus establish a best practise)?   txfee is 10000 through that file a fair few times.

Just asking, i'd be happy to do it if it is useful?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
the comment //opret limit wouldn't need to be there either.
If an ac would want larger opreturn, they could modify in komodo_defs much easier (presuming the codebase adopts it in the future).

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes it would be better, i think it is a defined variable somewhere

Author: Mylo#8306
